Selected Answer: C
A hard restart is the only option

questions.question_text:
A computer's power light is on, but the screen is completely black. The user is unable to wake the computer and then contacts a technician. The technician asks the user to inspect the display cable, but it is securely connected at each end.
Which of the following steps should the technician ask the user to take NEXT?

An end user's PC is taking a long time to boot.
Which of the following operations would be the BEST to resolve this issue with minimal expense? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A full defrag can make a noticeable change on the boot speed only if the computer is using a magnetic drive and not a SSD, also the loss in speed due to fragmentation is not from one day to another. Even further Win 8/8.1/10 defrag the drives on a weekly basis and there is no info that it is a Windows 7 PC. On the other hand a drive with very little space left can severely slow down a PC and a Cleanup Utility pass is way faster that a defrag and can make a big difference in speed by releasing a couple of GBs, in less time and with less waste over the HDD.
Any other opinion?

comments.content: Does this mean the answer should be B and F?

discussion.content: hence minimal expense going with A and F

I'm going to stick to A and B because I guess those three ABandF is right depending on the computer hard drive storage space or if it's heavily fragmented. It doesn't matter anyway the question is too lacking a point.

Selected Answer: BF
Remove apps from startup should not have anything to do with "Boot", only with loging into windows and after.

Selected Answer: BF
You will be so annoyed at the answer to this one... This is proof that CompTIA hates you and wants you to fail.

Everyone knows that the first thing you would check when troubleshooting a slow boot is the startup items, but the CompTIA exam is not based on actual reality. 

According to the official CompTIA prayer guide/songbook, they put "Cleanup And Defragment the hard drive" as the second option right after running the system troubleshooter. They list a number of other operations before they finally get to the "remove applications from startup" operation. 

I was pretty stumped by this one, because the two choices (defragment and cleanup) are so similar and have equal effect on system performance. So I looked in the official texts and found the answer. Defrag and Cleanup. *annoyed*

comments.content: the question is focused around /price/ not time. The cheapest option would be A and B

discussion.content: Isn't it a bit extra to defrag an entire drive?

choices.E: End the processes in Task Manager

questions.question_text: Which of the following WiFi protocols is the MOST secure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
WPA-3 Enterprise Most - MOST SECURE
WPA3 Encryption is covered by 256-bit Galois/Counter Mode Protocol (GCMP-256) so that makes breaking through the encryption harder. Has the highest level of encryption.

Selected Answer: A
WPA3

Also, normally there are WPA2-AES and WPA2-TKIP, instead of WPA-AES and WPA-TKIP

WEP is the weakest

I believe A is correct.
While C is cheaper and provides a reviewable entry log. it does not secure entry by itself. 
Key fobs can secure entry and be configured to keep records of entries and exits to track attendance, visitors or staff mobility.

comments.content: Also, if we are to assume an entry level roster inherently implies a security guard, then putting someone on salary would certainly be more expensive as an option.
Yeah, security guards are cheap these days. Go with A.

questions.question_text:
A company wishes to secure entry and provide a reviewable entry log to specific offices within its building.
Which of the following would be the lowest-cost solution to BEST meet the company's needs?

discussion.content: The answer is correct, because for data security you need encryption. Changing SSID name will not protect your data.
This such an awful question. It's either A or D.

questions.question_text:
A technician is setting up a SOHO router for a customer. Per the customer's requirements, data security is the highest priority.
Which of the following provides the MOST security for the network?
